column4: my (new) notebook's battery is sucked empty in no time on ubuntu. i had the suspicion that it uses the NVIDIA card instead of the power-saving intel graphix. but when i start nvidia x server settings it tells me nvidia driver is not used atm... any other ideas why it is empty so fast?
What laptop?
Dell XPS L502X
Make sure you have the proprietary (nVidia's) drivers, not the Nouveau junkware.
mhm how can i make sure? ;)
Check if the "nvidia-current" package is installed, unless you have installed it manually, from the NV website
The open-source drivers suck terribly when it comes to the power management.
i see. i didn't install anything. i just installed ubuntu and it worked already... so i have to change that i guess?
Seems like it's already installed.
mhm ok. well it was the very first time i unplugged the charger... maybe it's because of that?
Another thing work checking are the "Bumblebee" and "Ironhide" projects - unofficial implementations of Nvidia Optimus.
Unfortunately i can't help with them, since i don't even have a laptop.
